description.narrative: Syftet med insatsen är att genomföra en systemrevision av finansinstitutet Guateinvierte för en bedömning av deras kapacitet, system och rutiner. Guateinvierte har identifierats av Sida (avdelningen för Lån och Garantier, samt ambassaden) som relevant partner till Sida inom utlämnande av garantier genom kooperativ (Micoope) och bank (Banrural). Garantiinstrumentet kommer att vara riktat till målgrupperna för Helvetas och Swisscontacts projekt inom inklusiv ekonomisk utveckling som finansieras av ambassaden.

The aim is for Sida to provide a guarantee to Guate Invierte to share the risk in offering a guarantee to the target groups of the Helvetas and Swisscontact’s interventions.
The purpose of this assignment aims to assess the internal management and control of Guate Invierte and assess whether the organisation possesses adequate competence, capacity and routines to perform its duties and meet its objectives.
Guate Invierte is a Guatemalan guarantee trust fund (Fideicomiso) oriented to support mainly rural agricultural livestock and artisanal producers’ financial needs. In order for the producers to have access to working capital and to improve their qualification during credit assessment; Guate Invierte through the emission of a guarantee assumes a portion of the risk and supports the producers´ financial requests.
According to Sida’s rule for managing contributions, a risk analysis shall be carried out during the assessment phase before Sweden enters into an agreement with a partner organisation, as well as during the implementing phase of a contribution. One part of the risk analysis consists of assessing the internal management and control.

This assignment aimed at assessing the internal management and control of Guate Invierte and assess whether the organisation possesses adequate competence, capacity and routines to perform its duties and meet its objectives. The consultant is expected to identify eventual weaknesses. Based on the findings, Sida will require that Guate Invierte (hereafter called the “organisation”) addresses the weaknesses as appropriate before or during the guarantee agreement phase. The consulting was performed by the Audit Firm Moore Stephens, hired by the Embassy.
